required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Study of Tetomilast in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Associated With Emphysema
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Pilot Study to Assess the Pharmacodynamics, Efficacy and Safety of 50 mg Tetomilast Administered as Oral Tablets in Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Associated With Emphysema THIS STUDY IS CLOSED TO ENROLLMENT AND NEW SITES

brief_summary.textblock: Phase 2a multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study to assess the pharmacodynamics, efficacy, and safety of tetomilast in patients with emphysema.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 104 in Trough Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1)
primary_outcome.description: The analysis of the change from Baseline to Week 104 (last observation carried forward [LOCF]) in trough FEV1 is presented below.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of Change From Baseline to Week 104 in 20th Percentile of Lung Density Voxels
primary_outcome.description: The analysis of the change from Baseline to Week 104 (LOCF) in the 20th percentile of lung density voxels (expressed in Hounsfield unit [HU] using quantitative HCRT) by visit and lung region is presented below.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Trough FEV1 From Baseline to Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: The percent change for the pulmonary function tests (PFT) from baseline was calculated for each study week as follows: % change from baseline = ([value at Week X - value at baseline] /value at baseline) x 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Density Mask Score Based on Specified Thresholds Including -950 HU
secondary_outcome.description: The density mask score is defined as the percentage of lung density voxels that lie below a specified threshold in the lung region of interest. The higher the percentage of the participant's lung density voxels that lie below a specified threshold, the higher the level of the participant's emphysema in the lung region under consideration. Changes in the density mask score was assessed using only a single density mask threshold of -950 HU.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Change in the 20th Percentile of Lung Density Voxels Expressed in HU Units for the Whole Lung (Whole Right + Whole Left) From Baseline to Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of change in lung density was calculated as the change in the 20th percentile of lung density voxels divided by the duration between the dates of measurement (month or year) where applicable. For example, if HRCT measurements are available over a span of 2 years, the annual rate of change was calculated as the difference over the 2 years divided by 2, where years between scans is given by years= floor(data of last scan - date of first scan + 1)/365.25.

secondary_outcome.measure: Observed Rate of Change in Emphysema From Baseline to Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: The level of emphysema (g/L) within in a lung region is defined as the value of the selected percentile (10th, 15th, or 20th) in HU + 1000. The rate of change in the emphysema from baseline was calculated as the change in the level of emphysema from baseline to the specified visit divided by the time in years between the baseline and specified visit (i.e., [date of visit - date of baseline visit + 1]/365.25).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 104 in Cumulative Frequency of HU
secondary_outcome.description: The area under the curve (AUC) is defined as the cumulative voxel frequency in HU (ie, the value of the density mask denominator). Blood samples (4 mL) for pharmacokinetic analysis were collected for the determination of plasma OPC-6535 concentrations at Predose on Day 1 and Weeks 26, 52, 78 and 104.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 104 in Computed Tomography (CT) - Derived Lung Volumes (Total Lung Capacity [TLC] and Residual Volume [RV])
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in CT-derived lung volumes TLC and RV are presented in the below outcome data table.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 104 in Trough RV/TLC
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in Trough RV/TLC is presented in the below outcome data table.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 104 in Trough Inspiratory Capacity
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in Trough Inspiratory Capacity is presented in the below outcome data table.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 104 in Trough Functional Residual Capacity (FRCpleth)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in trough FRCpleth is presented in the below outcome data table.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 104 in Carbon Monoxide Diffusion Capacity (DLco)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in DLco is presented in the below outcome data table.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 104 in Mean Specific Airway Resistance (sRaw) and Specific Conductance (sGaw)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in sRaw and sGaw is presented in the below outcome data table.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 104 in 7-day Average Total Symptom Score of Dyspnea, Cough and Sputum
secondary_outcome.description: Participants used the Breathlessness, Cough, and Sputum Scale (BCSS) as the diary to daily monitor and rate their symptoms of difficulty breathing, cough, and sputum. The scale allows patients to rate each symptom on a scale of 0 (no difficultly for breathing and sputum, or unaware of coughing) to 4 (an almost constant problem for breathing and sputum, or almost constant for cough).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 104 in 7-day Mean Number of Actuations of Rescue Medications
secondary_outcome.description: Participants recorded rescue medication use (albuterol and/or ipratropium bromide) in a rescue medication log.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With COPD Exacerbations by Group at Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: For the COPD exacerbations, baseline is defined as Randomization (Day 1). COPD exacerbations, defined as an acute worsening of COPD symptoms, were classified as being in one of 3 levels: Level I (can by self-managed by the participant); Level II (requires a physician visit), or Level III (requires a hospital visit).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing a COPD Exacerbation (Level 2 or Higher)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants experiencing a COPD exacerbation in a level 2 or higher are presented in the below outcome data table.

intervention.description: Oral tetomilast 25 mg once daily for 2 weeks followed by 50 mg once daily for 2 years.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female, 40-75 yrs old,inclusive.
- Rating of greater than or equal to 1 on the Goddard scale in assessment of emphysema severity by HRCT.
- FEV1: FVC greater than 70% predicted.
- At least 1 documented COPD exacerbation within the past year but not within 8 weeks of randomization.
- Current or former smokers with a cigarette smoking history of at least 20 pack-years (or equivalent) and whose smoking status has not changed 60 days prior to screening.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with asthma, active tuberculosis or bronchiectasis.
- A respiratory tract infection within 30 days prior to the screening visit.
- Any malignancy within the last 5 years with the exception of non-melanomatous skin cancer.
- Uncontrolled cardiovascular, endocrine, blood, or nervous system disorders.
- Uncontrolled condition with COPD exacerbation of level 2 or 3 in the 8-week period prior to randomization.
- Systemic use of corticosteroids or other immunosuppressive agents within 30 days of the screening visit.
- Subjects taking anticoagulants.

facility.name: Texas Institute of Chest and Sleep Disorders, PA

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Of the 84 participants treated in the trial, 38 completed the trial and 10 participants were ongoing at the time the sponsor discontinued the trial.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Prior to randomization, each participant was in a 28- to 35-day screening period. Placebo was given for 14 days and a daily diary of symptom scores and actuations of albuterol/ipratropium bromide were collected.

group.title: Tetomilast 50 mg
group.description: Participants were administered oral tetomilast 25 milligram (mg) once daily for 2 weeks followed by 50 mg once daily for 102 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants were administered matching placebo for 104 weeks (2 years)

participants_list.participants: This is the number of participants who were treated and were considered as safety population.
This is the number of participants who were treated and were considered as safety population.

baseline.population: The safety population included all randomized participants who had received study medication. Participants in this population were used for all demographic and safety summaries. Participants were analyzed based on the treatment which they had received.

group.title: Tetomilast 50 mg
group.description: Participants were administered oral tetomilast 25 milligram (mg) once daily for 2 weeks followed by 50 mg once daily for 102 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants were administered matching placebo for 104 weeks (2 years)

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Week 104 in Trough Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1)
outcome.description: The analysis of the change from Baseline to Week 104 (last observation carried forward [LOCF]) in trough FEV1 is presented below.
outcome.population: The Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population consisted of all randomized participants with non-missing baseline data and at least one post-baseline trough FEV1 measurement or evaluable High-resolution computed tomography (HRCT) scan.

group.title: Tetomilast 50 mg
group.description: Participants were administered oral tetomilast 25 milligram (mg) once daily for 2 weeks followed by 50 mg once daily for 102 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants were administered matching placebo for 104 weeks (2 years)

measure.title: Change From Baseline to Week 104 in Trough Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1)
measure.description: The analysis of the change from Baseline to Week 104 (last observation carried forward [LOCF]) in trough FEV1 is presented below.
measure.population: The Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population consisted of all randomized participants with non-missing baseline data and at least one post-baseline trough FEV1 measurement or evaluable High-resolution computed tomography (HRCT) scan.

analysis.groups_desc: Statistical analysis at Week 104.
analysis.p_value_desc: P-values are based on Analysis of Covariance (ANCOVA) model of the change FEV1 from baseline to the specified study week using treatment group and current smoking status as fixed effects and the baseline FEV1 value as a covariate.

outcome.title: Rate of Change From Baseline to Week 104 in 20th Percentile of Lung Density Voxels
outcome.description: The analysis of the change from Baseline to Week 104 (LOCF) in the 20th percentile of lung density voxels (expressed in Hounsfield unit [HU] using quantitative HCRT) by visit and lung region is presented below.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of all randomized participants with non-missing baseline data and at least one post-baseline trough FEV1 measurement or evaluable HRCT scan. The number of participants analyzed at Week 104 were N = 43 and 25 respectively.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Week 104 in 7-day Mean Number of Actuations of Rescue Medications
outcome.description: Participants recorded rescue medication use (albuterol and/or ipratropium bromide) in a rescue medication log.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of all randomized participants with non-missing baseline data and at least one post-baseline trough FEV1 measurement or evaluable HRCT scan. The number of participants analyzed at Week 104 were N = 14 and 9 respectively.

group.title: Tetomilast 50 mg
group.description: Participants were administered oral tetomilast 25 milligram (mg) once daily for 2 weeks followed by 50 mg once daily for 102 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants were administered matching placebo for 104 weeks (2 years)

measure.title: Change From Baseline to Week 104 in 7-day Mean Number of Actuations of Rescue Medications
measure.description: Participants recorded rescue medication use (albuterol and/or ipratropium bromide) in a rescue medication log.
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of all randomized participants with non-missing baseline data and at least one post-baseline trough FEV1 measurement or evaluable HRCT scan. The number of participants analyzed at Week 104 were N = 14 and 9 respectively.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With COPD Exacerbations by Group at Week 104
outcome.description: For the COPD exacerbations, baseline is defined as Randomization (Day 1). COPD exacerbations, defined as an acute worsening of COPD symptoms, were classified as being in one of 3 levels: Level I (can by self-managed by the participant); Level II (requires a physician visit), or Level III (requires a hospital visit).
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of all randomized participants with non-missing baseline data and at least one post-baseline trough FEV1 measurement or evaluable HRCT scan.

group.title: Tetomilast 50 mg
group.description: Participants were administered oral tetomilast 25 milligram (mg) once daily for 2 weeks followed by 50 mg once daily for 102 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants were administered matching placebo for 104 weeks (2 years)

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With COPD Exacerbations by Group at Week 104
measure.description: For the COPD exacerbations, baseline is defined as Randomization (Day 1). COPD exacerbations, defined as an acute worsening of COPD symptoms, were classified as being in one of 3 levels: Level I (can by self-managed by the participant); Level II (requires a physician visit), or Level III (requires a hospital visit).
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of all randomized participants with non-missing baseline data and at least one post-baseline trough FEV1 measurement or evaluable HRCT scan.

analysis.groups_desc: Statistical analysis for level I (self management) at week 104.
Statistical analysis for level II (physician visit) at week 104.
Statistical analysis for level III (hospital visit) at week 104.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Experiencing a COPD Exacerbation (Level 2 or Higher)
outcome.description: Percentage of participants experiencing a COPD exacerbation in a level 2 or higher are presented in the below outcome data table.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of all randomized participants with non-missing baseline data and at least one post-baseline trough FEV1 measurement or evaluable HRCT scan.

group.title: Tetomilast 50 mg
group.description: Participants were administered oral tetomilast 25 milligram (mg) once daily for 2 weeks followed by 50 mg once daily for 102 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants were administered matching placebo for 104 weeks (2 years)

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Experiencing a COPD Exacerbation (Level 2 or Higher)
measure.description: Percentage of participants experiencing a COPD exacerbation in a level 2 or higher are presented in the below outcome data table.
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of all randomized participants with non-missing baseline data and at least one post-baseline trough FEV1 measurement or evaluable HRCT scan.

analysis.groups_desc: Statistical analysis at Week 104
analysis.p_value_desc: Fisher’s Exact test was used to determine whether the tetomilast and placebo groups differ in the proportion of participants who experienced Level 2 or higher COPD exacerbations during the study.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were reported from the signing of the informed consent, throughout the 104 week treatment period until the follow-up visit of 14 (+2) days.

group.title: Tetomilast 25 mg
group.description: Participants were administered oral tetomilast 25 milligram (mg) once daily for 2 weeks followed by 50 mg once daily for 102 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants were administered matching placebo for 104 weeks (2 years)

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This trial was terminated early, not due to a safety concern, but due to a business decision to cease development of the tetolimast clinical program.

point_of_contact.organization: Otsuka Pharmaceutical Development and Commercialization, Inc.
